archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
name: Restaurant-Style Malai Kofta with Saffron Jeera Rice, Cucumber-Mint Raita, and Warm Naan
description: A showstopper North Indian feast: crisp paneer-potato kofta in a rich cashew-tomato cream, paired with fragrant saffron jeera rice, cooling raita, and oven-warmed naan.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups basmati rice until water runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Soak 1/2 cup cashews in hot water 20 minutes; drain.
Finely chop 2 onions; mince 4 cloves garlic.
Grate 2 medium potatoes and 300 g paneer; squeeze out excess moisture.
Finely chop a handful of mint; grate 1 cucumber and squeeze out water.
Bloom a pinch of saffron in 2 tbsp warm water.
Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F for warming naan.
Measure spices: 2 tsp cumin seeds (split: 1 1/2 for rice, 1/2 for sauce), 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp ground cumin for raita, 2 bay leaves, 4 cardamom pods.
Set out 1 cup crushed tomatoes, 1/2 cup cream, 3 tbsp ghee (or oil), and salt.
Line a tray for shaped kofta; have oil ready for shallow-frying.
cook_steps: Make kofta mixture: In a bowl, combine grated potatoes, grated paneer, 3 tbsp chickpea flour, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp chili flakes. Mix to a soft dough; if sticky, add 1 more tbsp chickpea flour.
Shape 12 golf-ball kofta; chill 10 minutes to firm.
Blend sauce base: Blend soaked cashews with 1/2 of the chopped onions, 2 cloves garlic, and 1/3 cup water to a smooth paste.

Start saffron jeera rice: Heat 1 tbsp ghee in a pot; add 1 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, 2 bay leaves, and 4 cardamom pods until fragrant. Add drained rice; stir 1 minute. Add 3 cups water, 1 tsp salt, and saffron with its liquid. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and cook 12 minutes. Rest off heat 10 minutes, then fluff.
Fry kofta: Heat 1 cm oil in a wide pan over medium. Fry kofta in batches, turning, until golden-brown and crisp (4–6 minutes). Drain on paper towel.

Make sauce: In a separate pan, heat 1 tbsp ghee. Add remaining chopped onions and 2 cloves minced garlic; cook until golden. Add 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp chili flakes, and 1 tsp garam masala; stir 30 seconds.

Add crushed tomatoes; simmer 5 minutes. Stir in cashew-onion paste and 1/2 cup water; simmer 8–10 minutes until thick and glossy. Season with 1/2 tsp salt and a pinch of sugar (optional). Stir in 1/2 cup cream; simmer 2 minutes. Adjust salt and heat.
Hold kofta: Keep fried kofta separate; plan to combine just before serving to keep them crisp.
Make raita: In a bowl, mix 1 cup yoghurt, grated cucumber, chopped mint, 1/2 tsp ground cumin, and a pinch of salt. Chill.
Warm naan: Wrap naan in foil and warm in the oven 5–8 minutes.

Finish and serve: Heat sauce to a gentle simmer. Add kofta and coat for 1 minute (or serve sauce in a platter and place kofta on top to retain crunch). Plate with saffron jeera rice, raita, and warm naan.
